title: October 1–7: Early October Ops
description: Execute early October campaign operations while practicing communication, strategic team management, and voter engagement.

tasks.prompt: Team Management: Choose where to direct staff focus.

questions.question: Which staff focus will you prioritize?
options: Door-to-door outreach → boosts signatures but costs time
Fundraising calls → increases CC but risks less visibility
Media prep → improves public image but requires CC investment

tasks.prompt: Candidate Speech: Deliver a short, solutions-focused speech on community safety and family reassurance (1–2 paragraphs).
Weekly News Response: Respond to the provided current-events scenario to maintain or increase voter trust.

narrator: The campaign enters high visibility mode. You must focus on team management, community safety speeches, and responses to weekly news.
readingSummary: Early October requires balancing staff priorities with persuasive public messaging.
Candidate responses to weekly news and community concerns directly affect voter approval and campaign momentum.

tasksDetails.prompt: Select your staff management strategy to optimize campaign outcomes.

questions.question: Choose the primary focus for your staff this week:

tasksDetails.prompt: Write or dictate a community safety speech addressing safety, trust, and healthcare access. AI will evaluate clarity, empathy, and persuasiveness.
Respond to the weekly news scenario provided by the AI to simulate real-time campaign decision-making.

sources: General Election October 1–7 – Simulator Test Mode

outcome.description: Updated CC, voter approval, and campaign momentum. Demonstrated ability to lead staff, reassure voters, and adapt to evolving news.
